p: Grigorakis et al. [ 7] describe their work to find biologically-active compounds, such as polyphenol, from Stachys mucronata and study of its antiradical activity. These authors reported as major constituents: apigenin analogues, derivatives of the flavone luteolin, chlorogenate conjugates and flavonol glycosides, being the most potent radical-scavenging compounds detected in the n-butanol fraction of the extracts, suggesting that they are the most active antioxidants in Stachys mucronata. This study showed valuable data for future studies that will aim at investigating the possible biological effects of Stachys mucronata, which remain unexamined to date.
